data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 10 steps forward. Face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around means you will turn back around. The right turn means you will turn around again. So, the answer is Yes.

For each one of these instructions, if we repeat in one direction with the same starting point and the same number of steps, we go back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Take 1 step when you turn right. Turn left on the 7th step and take 7 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.

A seventy-seven-step round trip would return the user to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Just because it's taking 8 steps doesn't mean you'll take 9 steps back. The starting point is on the right side of the street. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward, you always take 3 steps right and take 8 steps backward because 3 forward steps mean you took 3 steps backward, and 3 backward steps mean you took 7 steps backward.
